message.content:
cs.IT, cs.MM, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.SY 

Reasoning: The paper deals with the problem of finding the rate-distortion function of an arbitrarily varying source (AVS) in the context of lossy compression of an active-vision video stream. This involves information theory (cs.IT) and machine learning (cs.MM) concepts. The paper also explores the model by attempting to find the rate-distortion function when the adversary is actually helpful, which could fall under computer vision (cs.CV) or machine learning (cs.LG). Additionally, the paper considers the case of partial or noisy observations of subsource realizations, which could involve systems and control (cs.SY) concepts.
